p: In the sub-region many febrile cases are presumptively diagnosed and treated for malaria. This is partly due to lack of diagnostic tools for these viruses in health facilities. Enormous attention given to the burden of malaria in Africa has been to the detriment of other febrile-causing pathogens including DENV and CHIKV [ 9]. This study is intended to augment limited data in the sub-region and provide a basis for the establishment of a surveillance program to minimize spread and possibly avert epidemics.
